snippet: Illegal hits drew long suspensions from the N.H.L. for repeat offenders Dan Carcillo of Chicago and Rene Bourque of Calgary.
abstract: Illegal hits drew long suspensions from the N.H.L. for repeat offenders Dan Carcillo of Chicago and Rene Bourque of Calgary.
lead_paragraph: Calgary Flames forward Rene Bourque and Chicago Blackhawks wing Dan Carcillo may now be wishing that they had not again incurred the wrath of the N.H.L.'s disciplinary department. The two players received significant suspensions -- five games for Bourque and seven for Carcillo -- in response to their actions in recent games.
